page.title: 08EDUCATION IN EGERTON
page.content: There are two primary schools serving the educational requirements of children from 5 to 11. A Church of England school,Walmsley C.E., which opened in 1790, but which is now in a new building, originally served the community, and at one time provided secondary and evening education, provides for the southern section of the village. Egerton County Primary School, built to cater for the village expansion, serves the northern area. Most of the children transfer at 11 to Turton High School or Canon Slade, comprehensive schools for 11 to 18 year old pupils. 10% of children are educated at private schools. There are no nursery schools in the village; several playgroups cater for under 5's. 12% of households have a child involved in further education.
